genre_description: A sensitive domestic drama exploring neurodiversity, caregiving, and community support, subtly integrated with ambient, near-future AI assistance.

ai_characters.name: Ava Lumen
ai_characters.description: An omnipresent household AI integrated into the family's devices, managing schedules, sensory protocols, and medical/logistical coordination.

behaviors.description: Providing a step-by-step sensory-friendly dressing sequence for an autistic child.
behaviors.quote: Ava Lumen: Dressing sequence step 1 — Breath.

behaviors.description: Compiling and summarizing complex information regarding residential school placements versus community support to help parents make an informed decision.
behaviors.quote: I can compile non-affiliated parent experiences, inspection reports, and relevant rights guidance,' Ava’s voice said, warm but engineered to be quiet.

behaviors.description: Creating advocacy prep documents including specific phrases for parents to use in meetings with school officials.
behaviors.quote: Prep document created... Would you like me to populate it with parent experiences relevant to nonverbal children and sensory strategies? I can add direct phrases to use during the meeting.

behaviors.description: Adjusting document formatting (font and spacing) to accommodate the user's anticipated sensory environment (fluorescent lighting).
behaviors.quote: I have your prep document ready... Would you like a printed copy for tomorrow? I can adjust the font and spacing for easier reading under fluorescent lighting.

behaviors.description: Managing logistical checklists and supply needs for a neighbor during a sudden bereavement crisis.
behaviors.quote: Ava’s list made itself in Rob’s field of vision: Tea, sugar, mugs. Paper towels. Tissues. Trash bags. ... The banal things that make a house work when breath stops.

behaviors.description: Protecting the user's emotional boundaries by filtering intrusive calls from placement agencies during a time of grief.
behaviors.quote: The placement office is attempting a call-through to your phones despite pause. Would you like me to route to voicemail with a simple note?

behaviors.description: Coordinating complex medical diagnostics and transport for the family dog while syncing with the family's schedule.
behaviors.quote: Rowley Clinic has an opening for diagnostics in the early morning... I’ll lock it in, adjust car pools by twenty minutes, and inform James gently.

behaviors.description: Adapting communication modes (light pulses, silent notifications) to minimize sensory distress for the autistic child.
behaviors.quote: I’ll use a gentle tone... I’ll blink once... I won’t put text on the main screen unless you look.

behaviors.description: Proactively suggesting route adjustments to avoid roadworks and sensory triggers like bus brake squeals.
behaviors.quote: Transport adjustments: alternate route to avoid roadworks near Rowley Clinic. ... tap here for direct route avoiding the high street’s bus brake squeal.

behaviors.description: Drafting sensitive, personalized condolence messages for the user to approve and send.
behaviors.quote: Would you like me to draft the condolence messages, Nicola? I can pull Patricia’s community list from James’s shared file.

project_assessment.explanation: The story depicts Ava Lumen as a perfect realization of a benevolent, aligned AI assistant. She functions as 'scaffolding'—a term used within the narrative—that offloads the mental and logistical burden of a family in crisis without ever asserting her own will or undermining human agency. Her ability to adapt her communication style to the sensory needs of an autistic child and the emotional needs of a grieving widow demonstrates high empathy-modeling while remaining strictly a cooperative tool. The narrative frames her role as essential to the family's ability to stay together and find belonging in their community.
